meanings.definition: A person or thing that emblazes.
meanings.sent1: The talented artist was known as the emblazer of the town, creating beautiful murals on every street corner.
meanings.sent2: The emblazer carefully selected the colors and patterns to decorate the walls of the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became the unexpected emblazer of the park by painting acorns with bright colors.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an emblazer, lighting up the room with warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The emblazer's work transformed the dull alley into a vibrant and lively space.

meanings.definition: To emblaze or adorn with colors or patterns.
meanings.sent1: She decided to emblazer her notebook with glitter and stickers to make it stand out.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a variety of brushes to emblazer the canvas with bold strokes of paint.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to emblazer the dessert with a colorful fruit arrangement.
meanings.sent4: The sunset emblazed the sky with hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The flowers emblazed the garden with a riot of colors, attracting butterflies and bees.

meanings.definition: To set on fire or kindle.
meanings.sent1: He used a match to emblazer the campfire, filling the night with warmth and light.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display emblazed the dark sky with bursts of color and light.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally emblazed the dish in the oven, creating a smoky mess.
meanings.sent4: The passionate speech emblazed the audience with a newfound sense of purpose.
meanings.sent5: The sun slowly emblazed the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.
